> Would you be willing to share your tool as a new open source project? The screenshot seems to be generated by a tool.

Consider contributing after it is perfected.

> You could add a new URI called from here. Reusing /testcase/annotation/success would be a confused way.

Thank you,I wiil fix it.
And I have another question.How can I get the real content which produce in webflux testcase.

> And I have another question.How can I get the real content which produce in webflux testcase.

What do you mean real? It is cached in the test tool memory. The source codes of the tool are here, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-agent-test-tool
No, there isn't. The old login is not real.
Use APISIX, Nginx or other proxy tech to set up a login page.
roger that

> Work for me. Please update the docker file in the main repo first.

main repo doesn't have this issue and uses the jdk based image all the time due to our development and debugging requirement.
Is this an official plugin? Or your private one?
It's not official. I wrote it myself
Then. you seems missing to call `stopSpan` in the main context. Please follow the plugin dev document.

I called the stopSpan in main context;I've solved this problem：
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54348450/93739511-0798ea80-fc1b-11ea-8654-a826f5223ae6.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54348450/93739535-1aabba80-fc1b-11ea-8288-fb5203432731.png)
No, this is absolutely the wrong way.
OK, I'll check my plugin again

mongo-java-driver seems to be an old package that contains codes such as bson. After version 3.9.1, maintenance has been discontinued and replaced by mongodb-driver-core+bson+mongodb-driver-sync. apm-mongodb3.x-plugin relies on mongo-java-driver, but mongodb-3.x-scenario relies on mongodb-driver (mongodb-driver-core+bson). Does it need to be adjusted?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16585330/93743994-a1fd2c00-fc23-11ea-82ff-0c1a279a1a26.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16585330/93744018-aa556700-fc23-11ea-8e7c-233668d2f076.png)


https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/mongodb/mongodb-driver-core/
If these changes happened, then we need witness classes to support both version. Two interceptors for 3.9.0 and 3.9.1+

> If these changes happened, then we need witness classes to support both version. Two interceptors for 3.9.0 and 3.9.1+
Okay, I will test it.
Need to adapt to all revisions, such as 3.12.0-3.12.6.
Register lock index has been removed since 8.0. We are not recommending to use the v2(6.x and 7.x) protocol based releases.

I saw that the version of our project is mongo-java-driver 3.0. I think that 3.x has no bugs and will not change it. I only change db.statement to db.bind_vars and remove executeMethod. What do you think?
Do you read what you said and document? A es7 image for es6?
I haven't done any other configuration
We highlighted this is for es7. Why you use in this way? Please read document.
I used ES7, not ES6, but the error message was ES6
You need configuration to activate core to use es7 implementation. That is why I am asking you to read document.

**Notice
From version 6.6.0, we split the oap image into two tags, x.y.z-es6, and x.y.z-es7. As their name indicates, es6 intends to connect to Elasticsearch 6, and es7 to Elasticsearch 7.

The latest tag points to es6**


but I use apache/skywalking-oap-server:8.1.0-es7,Where is the document you said

> I saw that the version of our project is mongo-java-driver 3.0. I think that 3.x has no bugs and will not change it. I only change db.statement to db.bind_vars and remove executeMethod. What do you think?

Once it is working, it is good to me.
I think you broke the UTs.

IMO, It's a very interesting feature. We are also working on the metrics for the agent side recently, for example the metrics of Kafka producer and consumer.

My question is whether it is possible to use micrometer in the plugin thru [`MeterBinder`](https://github.com/micrometer-metrics/micrometer/blob/master/micrometer-core/src/main/java/io/micrometer/core/instrument/binder/MeterBinder.java). Then everything would be extremely easy in the sense that there are a lot of micrometer implementations now.

I suppose so far the micrometer plugin is only available for the application.
MicroMeter has been supported for a while. This is for auto instrumentation metrics collection.

> I suppose so far the micrometer plugin is only available for the application.

Don't know what this means. @lujiajing1126

> > I suppose so far the micrometer plugin is only available for the application.
> 
> Don't know what this means. @lujiajing1126

I understand the micrometer support can be introduced by including `apm-toolkit-micrometer-registry` as a dependency in the service. And this requires manual work which is documented here https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Application-toolkit-micrometer.md

But I am wondering if it is possible to support micrometer in the core part. So we can adapt a collection of `MeterBinder` provided by the community of micrometer. For instance [KafkaClientMetrics](https://github.com/micrometer-metrics/micrometer/blob/master/micrometer-core/src/main/java/io/micrometer/core/instrument/binder/kafka/KafkaClientMetrics.java), we can use it directly in the constructor interceptor of `KafkaProducer` and `KafkaConsumer` which thus does not need any manual code in the application.

> But I am wondering if it is possible to support micrometer in the core part. So we can adapt a collection of MeterBinder provided by the community of micrometer. For instance KafkaClientMetrics, we can use it directly in the constructor interceptor of KafkaProducer and KafkaConsumer which thus does not need any manual code in the application.

This is very dangerous to do the integration. Use a 3rd party APIs and its implementation in the agent core would face the class loader issue. You should have noticed, we never introduce any other libs in the agent, unless the agent core uses itself, and it would be shaded in another package name to avoid conflict.

From my understanding of the micrometer system, KafkaClientMetrics is at the instrumentation side, once you activated that, and also activated the SkyWalking register, the metrics will flow into agent core directly. Have you tested?
Alarm can't and shouldn't targeting on the traces. That will crash the whole system.

> This is very dangerous to do the integration. Use a 3rd party APIs and its implementation in the agent core would face the class loader issue. You should have noticed, we never introduce any other libs in the agent, unless the agent core uses itself, and it would be shaded in another package name to avoid conflict.

Yes. I fully understood this concern. But also I believe as long as we shade the library and all its dependencies, that would not be a problem. We have developed some other agent which includes `micrometer` in the agent, of course with package shades. Everything works well except that we cannot talk to this kind of API from the application with any shaded class which is a known caveat.

> From my understanding of the micrometer system, KafkaClientMetrics is at the instrumentation side, once you activated that, and also activated the SkyWalking register, the metrics will flow into agent core directly. Have you tested?

Anyway, we will have an investigation first.

As I mentioned, shade is not the problem, the problem is why you need this. API-based instrumentation(Prometheus SDK or MicroMeter) solution should not be mixed with the agent. That breaks the design at the both side. 
If you have some private agenda on this, it is fine. But base on your given information, it doesn't make sense to me.

> As I mentioned, shade is not the problem, the problem is why you need this. API-based instrumentation(Prometheus SDK or MicroMeter) solution should not be mixed with the agent. That breaks the design at the both side.
> If you have some private agenda on this, it is fine. But base on your given information, it doesn't make sense to me.

I see what you meant. So I guess the so-called native implementation (metrics of the instrumented library) without third-party dependency is still acceptable in the community, right?
I don't know what do you mean acceptable. To accepy what? I think I am losing the context.

> I don't know what do you mean acceptable. To accepy what? I think I am losing the context.

I mean we can contribute some implementations of the metrics for the instrumented library, for example the metrics of Kafka producer and consumer with the help of metrics API provided by Skywalking agent (Probably after the current issue is resolved).
Yes, that is what these APIs for. We also require backend analysis config file and UI config. Then users could have these out of box.
Note, mostly, we expect these plugins are monotoring Kafka server. Consumer and producer have been traced already. Then we could have a real Kafa dashboard.

All of the English pages have been migrated to the new website.

Here are the plans for the three-phase of the new website.

## Phase I

**Home page**

1. The SkyWalking logo is missing from the navbar, it works on my local computer 😂
1. Add some more sections: latest events, blogs, and end-users brands
1. Adjust the color scheme to meet the SkyWalking culture
1. Change the background image @wu-sheng could you add more details about what do you like the design or the home page?
1. Mobile adaptIon

**Blog**

1. Modify the display elements of the list to add information such as author and tag.
1. Set the scheme information for the blog(this will be used on every blog post markdown header config)

**Events**

1. Adjust the page layout of a single evnet and fix display errors in the sidebar.

**Team & Downloads**

1. Adjust the layout, some part of the text are covered up.

## Phase II

1. Multi-language support
1. Migrate some blog posts to the website Github repo to test the layout

## Phase III

1. Integration test with the SkyWalking main repository
1. Setup the automation

@Fine0830 Could you help for the UI design and layout of the new website?

Consider the period is a moving window caching the metrics. Every minute is a slot in the window. 
Alarm core checks the window every minute. Count means the minimal count of value in the slot over threshold.

It actually solved the problem. Besides this `is_cache_enhanced_class`, I also need to turn on the other two as follows.
and seems it doesn't matter whether I set either true or false for `is_cache_enhanced_class`. either one works.

```
# If true, SkyWalking agent will save all instrumented classes files in `/debugging` folder.
# SkyWalking team may ask for these files in order to resolve compatible problem.
agent.is_open_debugging_class = ${SW_AGENT_OPEN_DEBUG:true}

# If true, SkyWalking agent will cache all instrumented classes files to memory or disk files (decided by class cache mode),
# allow other javaagent to enhance those classes that enhanced by SkyWalking agent.
agent.is_cache_enhanced_class = ${SW_AGENT_CACHE_CLASS:true}

# The instrumented classes cache mode: MEMORY or FILE
# MEMORY: cache class bytes to memory, if instrumented classes is too many or too large, it may take up more memory
# FILE: cache class bytes in `/class-cache` folder, automatically clean up cached class files when the application exits
agent.class_cache_mode = ${SW_AGENT_CLASS_CACHE_MODE:MEMORY}

```
